sentences.en: Bankers are quick to condemn retrospective tax legislation.
sentences.cn: 银行家们立即声讨有追溯效力的税收立法。

sentences.en: God does not approach us in order to condemn us.
sentences.cn: 神来就近我们,并不是要定我们的罪.

sentences.en: Graham was right to condemn his players for lack of ability, attitude and application.
sentences.cn: 格雷厄姆指责队员们技艺不佳、态度不端正而且不够努力，他说得没错。

sentences.en: He was condemned to life imprisonment.
He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.cn: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。
我痛恨这种粗鲁的态度.

sentences.en: If you are out to condemn sb ., you can always trump up a charge.
sentences.cn: 欲加之罪, 何患无词.

sentences.en: Now Liberals want to condemn people because of where they work?
sentences.cn: 现在自由主义者为了他们的工作而声讨人民?

sentences.en: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.cn: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.en: The papers were quick to condemn him for his mistake.
sentences.cn: 报纸及时地指摘他的错误.

sentences.en: Their lack of qualifications condemned them to a lifetime of boring, usually poorly-paid work.
sentences.cn: 他们资历的缺乏迫使他们要一辈子做单调乏味且通常报酬很低的工作。

sentences.en: Then you condemn me to live wretched and to die accursed?
sentences.cn: 那么你就是判定我活着受罪,死后要受诅咒了?

sentences.en: They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
sentences.cn: 他们大家聚集攻击义人、将无辜的人定为死罪.

sentences.en: To condemn to everlasting punishment or a similar fate; doom.
sentences.cn: 永世受罚,定罪:判决永远受处罚或处于类似的命运; 定罪.

sentences.en: We can condemn any gas into a liquid by cold.
sentences.cn: 我们可用冷凝法使任何气体变成液体.

sentences.en: We mustn't condemn him on mere suppositions.
sentences.cn: 我们不可全凭臆测来指责他.

sentences.en: Western Church was correct to condemn Pelagius was wrong.
sentences.cn: 奥古斯丁的预定论是正确的,伯拉纠(否定预定论)是错误的.

sentences.en: Yet others condemn them if they want to be traditional homemakers.
sentences.cn: 同样,如果她们想做家庭主妇,也会遭受一些人批评.

sentences.en: You hate and condemn and you live on and flourish.
sentences.cn: 你原谅和爱却继续被粉碎.

words.tran_cn: 该受责备的，应受谴责的；该罚的；应定罪的，该定罪的
谴责；定罪；非难的理由；征用

trans.tran_cn: 谴责，宣判，使陷入，宣布…不安全，证明…有罪
trans.tran_en: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

trans.tran_cn: 迫使（某人）陷于不幸的境地
trans.tran_en: if a particular situation condemns someone to something, it forces them to live in an unpleasant way or to do something unpleasant
